question: Scenario: You are creating a training institute website page that shows the UI course syllabus in order. Create a webpage that displays: Title: Ordered List Heading: UI Development Course Modules Ordered List: 1. HTML – Structure of web pages 2. CSS – Styling and layout design 3. JavaScript – Client-side interactivity 4. BootStrap – Responsive UI design 5. ReactJS – Modern frontend framework
sampleInput: Title => Ordered List Heading => UI Development Course Modules List Items: 1. HTML – Structure of web pages 2. CSS – Styling and layout design 3. JavaScript – Client-side interactivity 4. BootStrap – Responsive UI design 5. ReactJS – Modern frontend framework
answer:
UI Development Course Modules

  1. HTML – Structure of web pages
  2. CSS – Styling and layout design
  3. JavaScript – Client-side interactivity
  4. BootStrap – Responsive UI design
  5. ReactJS – Modern frontend framework

question: Scenario: You are designing a webpage that explains why students should learn HTML. Create a webpage that displays: Title: Un-Ordered List Heading: Benefits of Learning HTML Unordered List: • HTML is the basic building block of all websites. • It helps in creating and structuring web pages. • HTML is easy to learn and beginner friendly. • It is required to learn CSS and JavaScript. • HTML helps in building forms, tables, and layouts. • It is useful for careers in web development and full stack development.
sampleInput: Title => Un-Ordered List Heading => Benefits of Learning HTML List Items: • HTML is the basic building block of all websites. • It helps in creating and structuring web pages. • HTML is easy to learn and beginner friendly. • It is required to learn CSS and JavaScript. • HTML helps in building forms, tables, and layouts. • It is useful for careers in web development and full stack development.
answer:
Benefits of Learning HTML

  • HTML is the basic building block of all websites.
  • It helps in creating and structuring web pages.
  • HTML is easy to learn and beginner friendly.
  • It is required to learn CSS and JavaScript.
  • HTML helps in building forms, tables, and layouts.
  • It is useful for careers in web development and full stack development.
sampleOutput:
Benefits of Learning HTML

  • HTML is the basic building block of all websites.
  • It helps in creating and structuring web pages.
  • HTML is easy to learn and beginner friendly.
  • It is required to learn CSS and JavaScript.
  • HTML helps in building forms, tables, and layouts.
  • It is useful for careers in web development and full stack development.

question: Scenario: You are building a course overview page showing Full Stack technologies. Database i. Oracle ii. mysql

answer:
Full Stack Development Technologies

    2. CSS
    3. JavaScript
  2. Backend
    • Java

  3. Database
    1. Oracle
    2. mysql

question: Scenario: You are creating a course explanation page for beginners where important web terms are explained clearly. Create a webpage that displays: Title: Definition List Heading: Web Development Terminology Definition List: HTML HyperText Markup Language used to create the structure of web pages. CSS Cascading Style Sheets used to style and design web pages. JavaScript A scripting language used to add interactivity to websites. Frontend The part of the application that users can see and interact with. Backend The server-side part of the application that handles logic and database operations.
sampleInput: Title => Definition List Heading => Web Development Terminology Terms & Definitions: - HTML: HyperText Markup Language used to create the structure of web pages. - CSS: Cascading Style Sheets used to style and design web pages. - JavaScript: A scripting language used to add interactivity to websites. - Frontend: The part of the application that users can see and interact with. - Backend: The server-side part of the application that handles logic and database operations.
answer:
Web Development Terminology

HTML
HyperText Markup Language used to create the structure of web pages.
CSS
Cascading Style Sheets used to style and design web pages.
JavaScript
A scripting language used to add interactivity to websites.
Frontend
The part of the application that users can see and interact with.
Backend
The server-side part of the application that handles logic and database operations.
sampleOutput:
Web Development Terminology

HTML
HyperText Markup Language used to create the structure of web pages.
CSS
Cascading Style Sheets used to style and design web pages.
JavaScript
A scripting language used to add interactivity to websites.
Frontend
The part of the application that users can see and interact with.
Backend
The server-side part of the application that handles logic and database operations.
